title: About me
text:
I specialize in developing practical code to enhance scientific research outcomes. With a background in Data Science and Public Policy, I focus on streamlining data analysis, improving research workflows, and enhancing data visualization products for a variety of technical and non-technical audiences. I excel in collaborative environments, working closely with researchers to deliver efficient and impactful solutions. My goal is to leverage coding expertise to advance scientific knowledge and discovery.
I also have experience in developing packages tailored for research projects. These packages are designed to address specific challenges in data processing, analysis, and visualization, providing researchers with powerful tools to accelerate their work. My goal is to continue developing innovative solutions that directly contribute to the advancement of scientific knowledge.
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

title: Mitchell Lane
text:
Deakin University
Centre for Regional & Rural Futures (CeRRF)
2023 - current

Developed an R package to facilitate integrated assessment of hydrology-dependent outcomes in the Murray-Darling Basin under different climate scenarios.
Skills: R package development, Git version control, Quarto publishing.



Department of Education
Integrated Data Analytics
2021 - 2023

Led research projects to support priority policy areas, analysing large integrated administrative datasets (HEIMS, ABS, DOMINO, ATO) and developed interactive dashboards with R Shiny.
Authored technical guides, workflow templates, and reusable code for other analysts within the department for future projects. For example, computationally efficient data pipelines using {targets}.
